task_summary: Robot perceives location, approaches, and picks up a tube from a shelf.

task_long_description.overview: This episode depicts a robot arm tasked with picking up a tube placed on a shelf. The workspace includes a black shelving unit, a white tube to be picked, a second white object, and a flower vase. The robot must visually locate the tube, approach from above, align, open the gripper, compute a suitable top grasp, execute the grasp, and verify it has securely picked up the tube. No placement is required; task ends on successful pick. Scene lighting and occlusion are moderate, and additional obstacles (second object, vase) are not direct targets.
preconditions: Tube is placed on a shelf and accessible.
Robot arm is operational with empty gripper.
Workspace is clear of immediate obstructions in robot's path.
stepwise_plan: Verify tube is visible or scan until detected.
Move the end-effector above the tube with adequate clearance.
Align position for a top-down approach.
Open gripper to minimum width suited for the tube.
Compute a feasible grasp pose (top grasp) on the tube.
Check if tube is now securely in gripper.
success_criteria: End-effector aligned and gripper open above tube.
Tube is securely grasped and lifted from shelf.
failure_and_recovery: Tube not detected: initiate up to 3 scanning attempts.
Collision avoidance implicit in positional approach.
task_long_description.termination: When the tube is verified to be held in the gripper (ObjectInGripper is true) or recoverable failures are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the target tube is visible to sensors.
Performs a grid-pattern scan for the tube, up to 3 attempts.
Detects and localizes the tube with moderate speed.
Aligns gripper to target with 5mm precision.
Opens gripper to 4cm, suited for tube.
Plans a top-down grasp pose for the tube.
Executes grasp at planned pose using a top strategy.
Checks if the tube is securely held.

failure_modes: Tube not detected due to occlusion or lighting
recovery_strategy: Rescan for tube if not visible (up to 3 attempts)
Abort if grasp failsâ€”no internal retry beyond scan
assumptions: Instruction ('pick the tube') matches visuals: tube is visible and accessible
Tube is uniquely identified among the visible objects (not the larger white object or vase)
No conflicting signals between instruction and frames

expected_success_criteria: Tube held by gripper at end of sequence
